channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Leveraging Structure from Motion to Localize Inaccessible Bus Stops
item.description: Specifically, our method learns the locations of sidewalks in a given scene by applying a segmentation model and SfM to images from bus cameras during clear weather.

item.title: CLAD: A realistic Continual Learning benchmark for Autonomous Driving
item.description: In this paper we describe the design and the ideas motivating a new Continual Learning benchmark for Autonomous Driving (CLAD), that focuses on the problems of object classification and object detection.

item.title: PS-ARM: An End-to-End Attention-aware Relation Mixer Network for Person Search
item.description: Our PS-ARM achieves state-of-the-art performance on both datasets.

item.title: Preprocessors Matter! Realistic Decision-Based Attacks on Machine Learning Systems
item.description: By adding just a single preprocessor in front of a classifier, we find that state-of-the-art query-based attacks are as much as seven times less effective at attacking a prediction pipeline than attacking the machine learning model alone.

item.title: Multiple Object Tracking from appearance by hierarchically clustering tracklets
item.description: Current approaches in Multiple Object Tracking (MOT) rely on the spatio-temporal coherence between detections combined with object appearance to match objects from consecutive frames.

item.title: SpeechUT: Bridging Speech and Text with Hidden-Unit for Encoder-Decoder Based Speech-Text Pre-training
item.description: The rapid development of single-modal pre-training has prompted researchers to pay more attention to cross-modal pre-training methods.

item.title: Longtonotes: OntoNotes with Longer Coreference Chains
item.description: Ontonotes has served as the most important benchmark for coreference resolution.

item.title: Inferring Smooth Control: Monte Carlo Posterior Policy Iteration with Gaussian Processes
item.description: Monte Carlo methods have become increasingly relevant for control of non-differentiable systems, approximate dynamics models and learning from data.

item.title: Measuring and Narrowing the Compositionality Gap in Language Models
item.description: We then demonstrate how elicitive prompting (such as chain of thought) narrows the compositionality gap by reasoning explicitly instead of implicitly.

item.title: PCAE: A Framework of Plug-in Conditional Auto-Encoder for Controllable Text Generation
item.description: Visualization of the local latent prior well confirms the primary devotion in hidden space of the proposed model.

item.title: Scaling Forward Gradient With Local Losses
item.description: Forward gradient learning computes a noisy directional gradient and is a biologically plausible alternative to backprop for learning deep neural networks.

item.title: Calibrating Factual Knowledge in Pretrained Language Models
item.description: However, we find that facts stored in the PLMs are not always correct.

item.title: Towards Multi-Modal Sarcasm Detection via Hierarchical Congruity Modeling with Knowledge Enhancement
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel hierarchical framework for sarcasm detection by exploring both the atomic-level congruity based on multi-head cross attention mechanism and the composition-level congruity based on graph neural networks, where a post with low congruity can be identified as sarcasm.

item.title: Demystifying Map Space Exploration for NPUs
item.description: Map Space Exploration is the problem of finding optimized mappings of a Deep Neural Network (DNN) model on an accelerator.

item.title: Class-wise and reduced calibration methods
item.description: We prove for several notions of calibration that solving the reduced problem minimizes the corresponding notion of miscalibration in the full problem, allowing the use of non-parametric recalibration methods that fail in higher dimensions.

item.title: Understanding Transformer Memorization Recall Through Idioms
item.description: In this work, we offer the first methodological framework for probing and characterizing recall of memorized sequences in transformer LMs.

item.title: A Closer Look at Hardware-Friendly Weight Quantization
item.description: We study the two methods on MobileNetV1 and MobileNetV2 using multiple empirical metrics to identify the sources of performance differences between the two classes, namely, sensitivity to outliers and convergence instability of the quantizer scaling factor.

item.title: How Large Language Models are Transforming Machine-Paraphrased Plagiarism
item.description: The recent success of large language models for text generation poses a severe threat to academic integrity, as plagiarists can generate realistic paraphrases indistinguishable from original work.

item.title: Automatic Chain of Thought Prompting in Large Language Models
item.description: Providing these steps for prompting demonstrations is called chain-of-thought (CoT) prompting.

item.title: Set2Box: Similarity Preserving Representation Learning of Sets
item.description: Through extensive experiments on 8 real-world datasets, we show that, compared to baseline approaches, Set2Box+ is (a) Accurate: achieving up to 40. 8X smaller estimation error while requiring 60% fewer bits to encode sets, (b) Concise: yielding up to 96. 8X more concise representations with similar estimation error, and (c) Versatile: enabling the estimation of four set-similarity measures from a single representation of each set.

item.title: Latent Neural ODEs with Sparse Bayesian Multiple Shooting
item.description: Training dynamic models, such as neural ODEs, on long trajectories is a hard problem that requires using various tricks, such as trajectory splitting, to make model training work in practice.

item.title: Adversarially Robust Prototypical Few-shot Segmentation with Neural-ODEs
item.description: We show that our framework is more robust compared to traditional adversarial defense mechanisms such as adversarial training.

item.title: SpaceQA: Answering Questions about the Design of Space Missions and Space Craft Concepts
item.description: We present SpaceQA, to the best of our knowledge the first open-domain QA system in Space mission design.

item.title: IDa-Det: An Information Discrepancy-aware Distillation for 1-bit Detectors
item.description: This explains why existing KD methods are less effective for 1-bit detectors, caused by a significant information discrepancy between the real-valued teacher and the 1-bit student.

item.title: GMA3D: Local-Global Attention Learning to Estimate Occluded Motions of Scene Flow
item.description: Scene flow is the collection of each point motion information in the 3D point clouds.

item.title: Bi-directional Weakly Supervised Knowledge Distillation for Whole Slide Image Classification
item.description: Specifically, an attention-based bag classifier is used as the teacher network, which is trained with weak bag labels, and an instance classifier is used as the student network, which is trained using the normalized attention scores obtained from the teacher network as soft pseudo labels for the instances in positive bags.

item.title: AutoML for Climate Change: A Call to Action
item.description: The challenge that climate change poses to humanity has spurred a rapidly developing field of artificial intelligence research focused on climate change applications.

item.title: An Investigation into Whitening Loss for Self-supervised Learning
item.description: A desirable objective in self-supervised learning (SSL) is to avoid feature collapse.

item.title: Temporal Feature Alignment in Contrastive Self-Supervised Learning for Human Activity Recognition
item.description: Automated Human Activity Recognition has long been a problem of great interest in human-centered and ubiquitous computing.

item.title: UU-Tax at SemEval-2022 Task 3: Improving the generalizability of language models for taxonomy classification through data augmentation
item.description: The goal of the task is to identify if a sentence is deemed acceptable or not, depending on the taxonomic relationship that holds between a noun pair contained in the sentence.

item.title: Flexible Alignment Super-Resolution Network for Multi-Contrast MRI
item.description: To tackle this problem, the Flexible Alignment module is proposed to endow receptive fields with flexibility.

item.title: Instance Segmentation of Dense and Overlapping Objects via Layering
item.description: Instance segmentation aims to delineate each individual object of interest in an image.

item.title: Humans need not label more humans: Occlusion Copy & Paste for Occluded Human Instance Segmentation
item.description: In our work, we propose a simple yet effective data-centric approach, Occlusion Copy & Paste, to introduce occluded examples to models during training - we tailor the general copy & paste augmentation approach to tackle the difficult problem of same-class occlusion.

item.title: KRF: Keypoint Refinement with Fusion Network for 6D Pose Estimation
item.description: The CIKP method introduces color information into registration and registers point cloud around each keypoint to increase stability.

item.title: PARAGEN : A Parallel Generation Toolkit
item.description: PARAGEN is a PyTorch-based NLP toolkit for further development on parallel generation.

item.title: Pre-trained Adversarial Perturbations
item.description: Self-supervised pre-training has drawn increasing attention in recent years due to its superior performance on numerous downstream tasks after fine-tuning.

item.title: IronDepth: Iterative Refinement of Single-View Depth using Surface Normal and its Uncertainty
item.description: The depth of each pixel can be propagated to a query pixel, using the predicted surface normal as guidance.

item.title: Mars Rover Localization Based on A2G Obstacle Distribution Pattern Matching
item.description: Rover localization is one of the perquisites for large scale rover exploration.

item.title: Trans2k: Unlocking the Power of Deep Models for Transparent Object Tracking
item.description: Visual object tracking has focused predominantly on opaque objects, while transparent object tracking received very little attention.

item.title: Adaptive Ranking-based Sample Selection for Weakly Supervised Class-imbalanced Text Classification
item.description: To obtain a large amount of training labels inexpensively, researchers have recently adopted the weak supervision (WS) paradigm, which leverages labeling rules to synthesize training labels rather than using individual annotations to achieve competitive results for natural language processing (NLP) tasks.

item.title: Melody Infilling with User-Provided Structural Context
item.description: This paper proposes a novel Transformer-based model for music score infilling, to generate a music passage that fills in the gap between given past and future contexts.

item.title: The Sound of Silence: Efficiency of First Digit Features in Synthetic Audio Detection
item.description: The recent integration of generative neural strategies and audio processing techniques have fostered the widespread of synthetic speech synthesis or transformation algorithms.

item.title: Federated Boosted Decision Trees with Differential Privacy
item.description: There is great demand for scalable, secure, and efficient privacy-preserving machine learning models that can be trained over distributed data.

item.title: Few-Shot Calibration of Set Predictors via Meta-Learned Cross-Validation-Based Conformal Prediction
item.description: Conventional frequentist learning is known to yield poorly calibrated models that fail to reliably quantify the uncertainty of their decisions.

item.title: IR2Net: Information Restriction and Information Recovery for Accurate Binary Neural Networks
item.description: In contrast, considering the limited learning ability and information loss caused by the limited representational capability of BNNs, we propose IR$^2$Net to stimulate the potential of BNNs and improve the network accuracy by restricting the input information and recovering the feature information, including: 1) information restriction: for a BNN, by evaluating the learning ability on the input information, discarding some of the information it cannot focus on, and limiting the amount of input information to match its learning ability; 2) information recovery: due to the information loss in forward propagation, the output feature information of the network is not enough to support accurate classification.

item.title: hyperbox-brain: A Toolbox for Hyperbox-based Machine Learning Algorithms
item.description: hyperbox-brain is an open-source Python library implementing the leading hyperbox-based machine learning algorithms.

item.title: Guess the Instruction! Making Language Models Stronger Zero-Shot Learners
item.description: Meta-training, which fine-tunes the language model (LM) on various downstream tasks by maximizing the likelihood of the target label given the task instruction and input instance, has improved the zero-shot task generalization performance.

item.title: Augmentor or Filter? Reconsider the Role of Pre-trained Language Model in Text Classification Augmentation
item.description: Our study shows that even employing pre-trained language models, existing text augmentation methods generate numerous low-quality instances and lead to the feature space shift problem in augmentation instances.

item.title: Orthogonal Non-negative Matrix Factorization: a Maximum-Entropy-Principle Approach
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a new methodology to solve the orthogonal non-negative matrix factorization (ONMF) problem, where the objective is to approximate an input data matrix by the product of two non-negative matrices, the features matrix and the mixing matrix, while one of them is orthogonal.

item.title: PSVRF: Learning to restore Pitch-Shifted Voice without reference
item.description: Pitch scaling algorithms have a significant impact on the security of Automatic Speaker Verification (ASV) systems.
